full_description:
Sony Alpha FX30 Cinema Line Full-frame Camera (Body Only)

The Sony Alpha FX30, which leverages the power of a newly built APS-C sensor, gives daily content producers and aspiring filmmakers with a powerful, yet approachable cinema camera with which to take their cinematic journey to new heights. It combines a cinematic image pipeline with a rich feature set and simple operation to produce a full solution for all levels of filmmaking.

26MP APS-C/Super35 CMOS Sensor

The Alpha FX30 camera powerful imaging technology is comparable to other alternatives in Sony Cinema Line, capable of capturing detailed 10-bit UHD 4K footage at up to 120 frames per second, making it a genuine cinema camera. With the Super35 (16:9) area, the newly designed 26MP APS-C Exmor R CMOS sensor and BIONZ XR engine can produce high-quality 4K photos. This system has a dynamic range of 14+ stops and uses Dual Base ISO architecture to increase low-light performance.

Professional Picture Control

A new BIONZ XR processing engine of Alpha FX30 outperforms previous generations by up to 8x, enabling faster overall performance, impressive image quality with wide sensitivity and dynamic ranges, and more fluent processing capable of handling a slew of AI tasks and intelligent AF alongside imaging processes. For clear representation of moving subjects, this processing approach also minimizes rolling shutter and other motion aberrations.

5-Axis In-Body Image Stabilization

Sony has outfitted the Alpha FX30 with a 5-axis in-body image stabilization mechanism, which will aid in the creation of smooth pictures even while operating handheld. There is an Active Mode that combines optical technologies with digital enhancements to record ultra-smooth footage. When the optical stabilizers are switched off, the FX30 can also capture gyro movement, which may be utilized in post to create a steady shot.

Fast Hybrid AF

Enjoy fast and precise focusing performance in all modes of Sony Alpha FX30, including 4K at up to 120 frames per second, thanks to an innovative Fast Hybrid AF system that employs 495 points distributed across 90% of the image sensor. Human and animal eyes will be tracked using Real-time Eye AF and Real-time Tracking. With a rotation of the lens' focus ring, the AF Assist function will automatically convert to manual focus. Focus Map helps you see the region of focus in your scene.

Comprehensive Feature Set

Many Sony cinema features have made their way into the Alpha FX30. Breathing adjustment works with certain lenses in 4K up to 60p in camera or up to 120p after recording using Catalyst software. Timecode sync input via optional VMC-BNCM1 Timecode Adapter Cable Tally lights indicate that the camera is recording.

Media Options

The Alpha FX30 employs an innovative, adaptable set of media slots for capturing high-bitrate footage at high frame rates. The camera has twin CFexpress Type A/SD card ports, allowing users to choose between different media formats for various scenarios. CFexpress Type A cards offer ultra-fast speeds and can be used for the most advanced recording functions on the FX30, although SD cards are more popular and still have amazing speed and capacity.

Ergonomic Form for Solo Operation

The Sony Alpha FX30 (with a form similar to the FX3) is lightweight and tiny, allowing users to shoot without a cage. A 5-axis in-body image stabilization device also allows for smooth handheld shooting. The body has various threaded mounting holes for attachments as well as a Multi Interface Shoe that supports sophisticated accessories. Furthermore, an inbuilt fan enables consistent performance throughout long shoots.

Updated Menu System

The SonyAlpha FX30has a revised control menu that makes it easier to use. The main menu displays all of your most significant video options, such as Picture Profile, recording format, white balance, aperture, ISO, and others. The shooting screen moves the information on settings and status symbols to the screen's edges to keep the image uncluttered.

A Plethora of Connectivity Options

The Alpha FX30 comes with a plethora of connectors for optimum customization and versatility on set. Full-size HDMI output supports 4K 60p clean output as well as 16-bit raw video. A 3.5mm headphone output and a 3.5mm microphone input are provided on the body for audio. The USB-C port may be used to transport data at fast speeds or to charge the camera.

full_description:
Sony FX3 Full-Frame Cinema Line Camera (Body Only)

The incredibly small Sony Alpha FX3 Cinema Line camera offers full-frame cinematic expression and exceptional sensitivity. It's the perfect creative instrument to capture a cinematic vision wherever you are thanks to greater mobility for simple solo shooting and professional operability. High sensitivity and a broad dynamic range are provided for Full-frame performance. It has a BIONZ XR high-performance image processing engine. It offers 4K (QFHD) 120 fps high frame rate recording. S-Cinetone and Cinematic Color Science are built into the camera. It provides improved mobility for lone operation.

Cinematic color science of S-Cinetone

Sony Alpha FX3's default look for cinematic expression is the S-Cinetone color, which was created for Sony's famed FX9. Its genuine skin tones and rich color match other Cinema Line cameras without grading, making it exactly suited to satisfy the needs of today's content producers.

4K 120fps with every frame in focus

The high-precision AF and high-speed readout capabilities of the Sony Alpha FX3 allow for the acquisition of detailed 4K imagery even at high frame rates. You have complete control over the shooting frame rate using the Slow and Quick (S&Q) mode, allowing for stunning motion sequences at up to 5x slow motion (with 24p output).

10-bit S-Log3 and HDR recording for smooth gradations

S-Gamut3.Cine and S-Log3 gamma curves make it possible to shoot with high-quality color reproduction over a wide dynamic range, and they also make it simple to match footage with pictures from Sony Alpha FX3 Cinema Line cameras during post-production. Additionally, an HLG (Hybrid Log-Gamma) HDR picture profile allows for direct HDR (HLG) playback on compatible TVs without any additional post-production.

16-bit RAW HDMI output 

While XAVC HS 4K, XAVC S 4K, XAVC S-I 4K, and proxy files are simultaneously captured in-camera, 16-bit RAW output is available over HDMI connection to suitable external recorders for demanding post-production workflows. RAW video output exceeds DCI-4K resolution at 4264 x 2408 [16:9] resolution.

Smooth transitions and touch focus control

The Sony Alpha FX3 has five AF Subject Shift Sensitivity settings that let the user choose how readily AF will switch or stay with the locked-on subject. It also has seven settings for AF Transition Speed, which makes it simple to generate rack focus. By just touching the LCD monitor, you can easily choose the topic you want to concentrate on.

In-camera image stabilisation 

Sony Alpha FX3 Cinema Line Full-frame An optical in-body 5-axis picture stabilization feature on the camera offers greater stabilization for filming. The gyroscope sensor precisely detects camera shake and makes an optical adjustment to maintain image quality. This enables stable footage to be captured even when shooting hand-held without a gimbal, while moving, and at 4K resolution.

Vari-angle LCD touch-panel monitor

When Sony Alpha FX3 is mounted on gimbals, the side-opening 3.0-type (1.44 million-dot) LCD touch-screen panel allows for flexible placement and enhanced visibility. Additionally, touch-panel capability offers simple menu navigation for many camera settings.

Dual high-speed media slots

The high bit-rate recording capabilities of CFexpress Type A cards are designed to meet the needs of next-generation filmmaking. The camera has two identical media slots that allow for relay or backup shooting. The slots are ready for CFexpress Type A cards as well as regular SDXC UHS-I and UHS-II cards.

full_description:
Sony PXW-Z90V 4K HDR XDCAM Camcorder

The Sony PXW-Z90V 4K HDR XDCAM camcorder has phase-detection autofocus (AF) and HDR in a small, palm-sized body. The PXW-Z90V camcorder is ideal for corporate events, broadcast news, and television production. It has a stacked 1" Exmor RS CMOS sensor with UHD 4K (3840 x 2160) resolution, a 12x Zeiss optical zoom, an OLED viewfinder, and a 3.5" touchscreen LCD monitor. It can record 4K in XAVC Long at 4:2:0, HD in XAVC Long at 4:2:2 10-bit, and MPEG HD at 4:2:2 (with an optional licensing key). S-Log3/S-Gamut3 capabilities provide customers more picture control. Built-in 2.4/5 GHz enables multiple streaming via RTMP/RTMPS protocols and FTP choices. The PXW-Z90V camera supports Sony's Slow and Quick Motion, which allows you to record HD video at a variety of frame rates, including 120 fps. The camcorder can record to a number of formats, frame rates, and codecs, including 100 Mb/s XAVC Long for 4K UHD video at up to 29.97p and 50 Mb/s for HD up to 59.94p. Footage is recorded on two SD memory card slots, either concurrently or in relay mode to make a backup. The PXW-Z90V's 3G-SDI output enables integration with professional studio setups.

Live Streaming

The camera supports the RTMP and RTMPS live streaming protocols. This is included with the camera and available as a free upgrade if your camera does not already have this feature. You may stream straight from the camera via Wi-Fi or Ethernet with extra converters like the Sony VMC-UAM2 or CBK-NA1. Streaming does not require a computer.

Integration

The camera is compatible with Sony's XDCAM air, allowing you to upload proxy footage to the cloud and begin editing remotely. Sony's free Content Browser Mobile software allows you to manage the camera directly from your smartphone or tablet.

product_page_short_description: Sony G Lens with 12x Optical Zoom
full_description:
Sony PXW-Z150 4K XDCAM Camcorder

The Sony PXW-Z150 4K XDCAM Camcorder combines high-quality performance, versatility, and convenience of use in a tiny, portable design that is the same size as the HXR-NX100. Ideal for corporate video, house of worship, and legal deposition recordings. The camcorder has a single Exmor RS sensor with UHD 4K (3840 x 2160) resolution, a Sony G lens with 12x optical zoom, and 18/24x Clear Image Zoom in 4K/HD. It can record 4K in XAVC Long at 4:2:0 8-bit, HD in XAVC Long at 4:2:2 10-bit at 50 Mb/s, and MPEG2HD at 4:2:2 or 4:2:0 in 8-bit. The integrated zoom lens has distinct lens control rings for focus, iris, and zoom, and it creates beautiful, rounded out-of-focus highlights. The camcorder can store up to 6 picture profiles and share them; it also supports Sony's Slow and Quick Motion for capturing HD video at a variety of frame rates, including 120 fps. The camcorder can record to a number of formats, frame rates, and codecs, including 100 Mb/s XAVC Long GOP of 4K UHD video at up to 29.97p, HD at up to 59.94p, MPEG HD at up to 59.94p, and AVCHD 2.0 at up to 59.94p. Your film is recorded to media using two SD memory card slots. You may record concurrently on both cards or use the relay mode, which automatically switches recording to the second memory card when the first one is full. It includes Wi-Fi and NFC connection.

1" Exmor RS CMOS Sensor

The PXW-Z150 features a 1.0" Exmor RS CMOS sensor with over 14.2 million effective pixels. The R designation indicates that this is a backside-illuminated sensor, while the S designation refers to the buffer design and the ability to read information from the sensor significantly quicker than a non-S designated sensor.

Sony G Lens with 12x Optical Zoom, 24x Clear Image Zoom

The PXW-Z150 comes with a fixed 12x optical zoom wide-angle Sony G lens, which corresponds to a 29 to 348mm 35mm lens. Sony's Clear Image Zoom technology extends the 12x optical zoom capability to an apparent 18x in 4K. The 12x optical zoom in HD can be increased to 24x with Clear Image Zoom, and the Digital Extender feature can increase this range to 48x zoom.

Frame Rate Flexibility

The camera captures UHD 4K video (3840 x 2160p) at 29.97, 25, and 23.98 fps in XAVC Long GOP at speeds of 100 or 60 Mb/s. You may also choose to record HD video instead of 4K, which allows you to record at conventional frame rates up to 59.94p while also utilizing Sony's S&Q Motion to record HD video at 1, 2, 4, 8, 15, 30, and 60 fps.

Lens Control

Three lens rings allow for smooth, natural adjustment of focus, zoom, and iris. Although the rings are not technically related to the lens movement, they nevertheless have a mechanical sensation. However, they revolve indefinitely, protecting your lens elements from pinning, and the faster you move the lens ring, the more reactive the outcome. For ultimate creative freedom, the lens may be set to full-auto or entirely manual mode.

full_description:
Sony FX6 Full-Frame Cinema Line Camera (Body Only)

The Sony FX6 Full-Frame Cinema Line Camera is built with an Exmore CMOS sensor and a Bionz XR. It delivers fast readout speeds as well as a dynamic range of 15+ stops to deliver superb image quality with wide sensitivity. The full-frame sensor and expanded ISO sensitivity give you the freedom for 4K imagery or low light shooting in a range of settings using a base ISO of 800 as well as an ISO 12800. The FX6 is capable of 4K internal recording, encoding 10-bit depth and 4:2:2 colour sampling with either Full-HD Long-GOP or 4K All Intra compression. You can record right on the camera with the amazing richness of 10-bit depth and 4:2:2 colour sampling, for far greater flexibility in image grading, post-processing and compositing. For demanding post-production workflows, the 16-bit RAW output is available via SDI connection to compatible external recorders while XAVC-I files are simultaneously captured in-camera. The FX6 captures up to 120 frames per second (fps) at the 4K (QFHD) resolution. Slow and Quick (S&Q) modes give you full control over the captured frame rate from 1 to 120fps, allowing precise motion narratives, and up to a beautiful 5x Super Slow Motion (24fps output). Weighing just under 2 lb, the FX6 body is a full 2 lb lighter than the FX9 and measuring 6 x 4.6", it packs a full-frame sensor into a body comparable to the S35-sensor Sony FS5. While the FX6 fits seamlessly into a pro-cine on-set workflow, it also offers several features that are a boon for a single-operator user. A 3.5" High-definition 2.76 million-dot flexible LCD panel that boasts timesaving touchscreen access to key menu settings and versatile positioning for comfortable operating. The Sony FX6 Full-Frame Cinema Line Camera has no warranty.

values.value: 35 mm full-frame, single-chip CMOS image sensor

Sony PXW-FX9 XDCAM 6K Full-Frame Camcorder (Body Only)

Sony PXW-FX9 XDCAM 6K Full-Frame Camcorder supports 4K capturing with oversampled 6K Full-frame Exmore R sensor. The 35.7 x 18.8 mm (Full-Frame) 20.5 Megapixel CMOS sensor has an effective resolution of 19 Megapixel. 15+ stops of dynamic range and Dual Base ISO enable you to capture every moment and detail using either 4K 4:2:2 10-bit internal recording or 16-bit RAW external recording. It has ISO 800 to 4000 (Native) and 320 to 102,400 (Expanded). You can choose your desired frame rate from 1fps up to 180fps for impressive quick- and slow-motion footage. It also offers a Quality priority setting that maximizes full HD image quality using full-frame 6K scan mode or Super 35 4K scan mode with advanced oversampling technology. It supports Built-in Wi-Fi and 12G-SDI. It has no warranty.

Sony HXR-NX200 Full HD compact professional NXCAM camcorder is an affordable, compact camcorder with a big 1.0-type sensor and new colour reproduction for superb 4K or Full-HD image quality. It offers all the professional features you need with refined manual controls including three independent manual lens rings, smart fully auto options and more.A large, 20 megapixel* 1.0 type sensor delivers stunning image quality in 4K (3840Ã—2160) or Full-HD at 50Mbps. Its 1.0 sensor is brighter, has higher resolution and offers more bokeh with a shallow depth of field. Sony HXR-NX200 gives you the flexibility to work the way you want to.The HXR-NX200â€™s single 20 megapixel* 1.0 type Exmor R CMOS sensor is approximately the same size as a 16mm film frame and seven times larger than three 1/4.7 type sensors combined. The key benefit of this large size is low noise and less blur because more light reaches the sensor, offering clear and steady pictures even in a dark scene with minimum illumination 1.7 lux**. The large sensor size also enables beautiful background defocussing (bokeh) to enable you to focus on what you want to show and defocus the rest of the image.It newly developed gamma curve provides a vibrant look ready to share as soon as you export.

full_description:
Sony HXR-NX100 NXCAM Professional Camcorder from brings high-quality performance, adaptability, and ease of use to a compact, handheld body. The camcorder features a single Exmor R sensor with Full HD 1920x1080 resolution, Sony G lens with 12x optical zoom range, and a 24x Clear Image Zoom. The integrated zoom lens features individual lens control rings for focus, iris, and zoom. The lens can be used in either full-auto mode with servo control, or as a completely manually operated lens. The camera supports storing up to 6 picture profiles and allows you share profiles between multiple NX100 camcorders. The camera also supports Sony's Slow and Quick Motion for shooting HD video at variable frame rates. Recording to a variety of formats, frame rates and codecs, the camcorder supports the XAVC S codec recording Full HD video at up to 59.94p, AVCHD 2.0 up to 59.94p, and DV for SD video. Your footage is recorded to media via 2 x SD memory card slots. You can choose to record simultaneously to both cards or use the relay mode which switches recording automatically to the second memory card when the first one is full. The two card slots can be controlled independently from two separate record buttons. 2 x 3-pin XLR audio inputs support line, mic, and mic + 48 V (phantom power) for using professional microphones. The camera also includes IR capability for shooting in extremely dim lighting conditions as well as date/time stamp functionality.


03 Years Service Warranty (No parts warranty)
